description.narrative: MJ will contribute towards enhancing WBI and prevention of GBV in three targeted locations through providing five sexual awareness workshops to seventy mothers in three targeted areas, as well five awareness work shops to seventy youth at risk adolescents, thosetarget group will be targeted by fifteen professional and human rights activists who will be trained by MJ for more than sixty hours of training around sexuality education and skills to conduct such awareness raising activities, MJ will as well raise awareness ofthe public through their website which is active and answer different questions from public around sexual education and how to respond to those issues with children and adolescents. MJ will contribute as well to enhance access to GBV and SRHR services in marginalized areas by taking part in building skills and knowledge of 45 targeted field workers/coordinators from non-WROs in three targetedareas in the west bank by providing intensive training on sexuality and sexual education to help them to give advice to marginalized and vulnerable women that they meet in the field and as well how to access services of SRHR in the west bank, as well MJ will conduct four individual supervision for the 45 field coordinators and staff to guide them in the complex cases they faced and how to overcome obstacles.

participating-org.narrative: Muntada -The Arab Forum for Sexuality, Education and Health - was officially registered as a non-profit organization in April 2006 by a group of professional women who have worked in the Palestinian society for many years on a voluntary basis. The grassroots workconducted by these women has attracted many others, including men, to obtain training in sexuality education and to join Muntada's social programs that aimed at raising sexual awareness among the Palestinian society. Muntada#s advocacy and training work in various sectors has gained recognition from the official establishment as the only address in the Palestinian society for sexuality related services. Muntada has trained hundreds of professional cadres, which played an important role in the creation of local focus areasto promote sexuality rights and education in a large number of Palestinian villages and towns. While bulk of Muntadas projects target Palestinians inside Israel however in 2009, it extended its geographic outreach to East Jerusalem and the West Bank, through joint pilot projects with Bethlehem University and the Women's Study Center. Regarded locally as a major professional and intellectual hub in the field of human sexuality, Muntada is also dynamically building connections with Arab and international networks that shareprinciples of universal human rights and sustainable development. For instance, in 2010, Muntada was accepted as an affiliate of the Coalition for Sexual and Bodily Rights in Muslim Societies (CSBR).
